description.plain:
Marc E. Bassy, real name Marc Griffin, is a former vocalist of the LA-based pop band 2AM Club.

Originally from the San Fransisco Bay area, Marc is now located in Los Angeles where he has established himself as one of pop’s rising stars, in large thanks to his 2016 hit “You & Me” which peaked at #58 on the Billboard Hot 100. He is also a frequent collaborator of G-Eazy, who featured on “You & Me” and who had Marc feature on his Hot 100 hit, “Some Kind of Drug”.

body.plain:
Marc E. Bassy, real name Marc Griffin, is a former vocalist of the LA-based pop band 2AM Club.

Originally from the San Fransisco Bay area, Marc is now located in Los Angeles where he has established himself as one of pop’s rising stars, in large thanks to his 2016 hit “You & Me” which peaked at #58 on the Billboard Hot 100. He is also a frequent collaborator of G-Eazy, who featured on “You & Me” and who had Marc feature on his Hot 100 hit, “Some Kind of Drug”.

songs.full_title: You & Me by Marc E. Bassy (Ft. G-Eazy)
songs.title: You & Me

description.plain:
The soothing reggae-pop record marks the first single for Marc E. Bassy’s upcoming album Groovy People. Bassy is joined by local Oakland superstar G-Eazy, with whom Bassy toured following the release of When It’s Dark Out. This is the fourth collaboration between Marc and G, following “Friend Zone,” “Some Kind of Drug,” and “Show Me.”

Marc spoke to Complex about having G-Eazy on the track, where he pointed out the importance of having a Bay Area artist on his first single, and the chemistry they developed. Even so, he told Genius that he wasn’t going to have G-Eazy on his first single originally, but felt G-Eazy was going through a very similar situation that he could speak on.

The soothing reggae-pop record marks the first single for Marc E. Bassy’s upcoming album Groovy People. Bassy is joined by local Oakland superstar G-Eazy, with whom Bassy toured following the release of When It’s Dark Out. songs.lyrics:
33 ContributorsYou & Me Lyrics[Verse 1: Marc E. Bassy]
Girl you party all the time
Don't let me stay on your mind
Adderall and cheap wine
Just to stay awake in conversation
We were always so damn insecure
So how could we ever know for sure
And disregard the way I know we feel
That would make this city way too real

[Chorus: Marc E. Bassy]
If we bump into each other
On a crowded street
It’s not us no more
It’s just you and me
We’re just strangers in passing casually
It’s not us no more
It’s just you and me
[Verse 2: Marc E. Bassy]
The shirt on my back with the rips
Gems in my golden necklace
You didn't give me none of this
There's nothing for me to miss
We were too young on the day we met
How could we say we would not forget
And in the shadows there's a place for us
Somewhere hidden they can't find our love
Don't let 'em know

[Chorus: Marc E. Bassy]
If we bump into each other
On a crowded street
It’s not us no more
It’s just you and me
We’re just strangers in passing casually
It’s not us no more
It’s just you and me
[Verse 3: G-Eazy]
Eazy, and these days it's just you and me
This shit is dead and gone, it's not what it used to be
Someone give a eulogy
Know I'm hard headed and I might of acted foolishly
But you the one to hold us down usually
We was in a limbo
But of all people you ain't have to fuck with him though
That was my homie I had gave y'all the intro
Some things fall apart and some get thrown out the window
Remember when we first met we might've been too young
But we was from The Bay so we both was going too dumb
I used to be the one for you now you got a new one
So till the next lifetime, maybe we can do some'n
Eazy
You might also like[Hook: Marc E. Bassy]
If we bump into each other
On a crowded street
It’s not us no more
It’s just you and me
We’re just strangers in passing casually
It’s not us no more It’s just you and me

[Outro: Marc E. Bassy]
If we bump into each other
On a crowded street
It's not us no more23Embed

songs.title: Morning

description.plain: In this song, Bassy is questioning the faithfulness of his lover. Though he has flaws himself, he wonders if his lover will still love him, even after the mistakes he’s made.

songs.embed_content: Read “Morning” by Marc E. Bassy on Genius

body.plain: In this song, Bassy is questioning the faithfulness of his lover. Though he has flaws himself, he wonders if his lover will still love him, even after the mistakes he’s made.

songs.lyrics:
19 ContributorsMorning Lyrics[Verse 1]
With no makeup on and your eyelash hanging
I would still love you
If you came home late and you kept me waiting
I would still trust you
If the richer man was looking at you
Would you stay cold as a statue?
Would my love still be good for you?

[Chorus]
Would you be there in the mornin', mornin', mornin' , mornin'?
Would you be there in the mornin', mornin', mornin' mornin'?
Would you stay here from the sunset to the sunrise?
When I open up both eyes
Be there in the mornin', mornin', mornin'
[Verse 2]
If I pass out drunk and you check my message
And see my exes
Would you still believe that it's only just us
And I'm not reckless?
Would you know if I ever laid with another lover?
We was on a break, babe and I wore a rubber
Would you forgive me?

[Chorus]
Would you be there in the mornin', mornin', mornin' , mornin'?

Would you stay here from the sunset to the sunrise?
When I open up both eyes
Be there in the mornin', mornin', mornin'

And last night, last night
I dreamed of a woman
Dark brown eyes
Daddy told her all she knows
She brought me to life
She set my soul in motion
And there's only one thing that I gotta know

[Chorus]

songs.full_title: Lock It Up by Marc E. Bassy (Ft. Kehlani)
songs.title: Lock It Up

description.plain:
Using a sample from the classic Erykah Badu song, “Bag Lady”, Marc E. Bassy collaborates with the lovely stylings of Kehlani and Jahaan Sweet to create a smooth, modern-day love song. The phrase, “Lock It Up” means that they want to make the relationship official, to “lock someone down” and to be together.

This song expresses both the male and female’s take on their history with one another, especially when it comes to the sexual connection they have. By the end of the song, it is clear that they both want to forget all the negativity of the past and move on with each other.

24 ContributorsLock It Up Lyrics[Intro: Marc E. Bassy]

You know that shit cool with me
High than whatever, pop whatever

As long as you're here, as long as your down
Roll it up in your lap, put it in your mouth
I think it's time to lock it up, lock it up

Leave it all behind

Picking my fights for me

You tell your friends that he don't look like Trey

Don't hide your intentions, don't be scared to mention
That you want to hear me scream your name

I can take you high, I can take you low

I just wanna lock it up, lock it up
Baby I'm just trying to lock it up, lock it up
